item.title: RF-Sports-Radio-NBA-Playoffs-Thunder-Heat-Spurs-Celtics-NFL - Jun 01,2012
item.description:
"Sports Talk from a Fans Perspective when YOU want it!" www.RFSportsRadio.com or Follow us on Twitter @RFSportsRadio Thunder rout the Spurs102 - 82 snapping their 20 game win streak to make the Western Conference finals 2-1. Rondo puts on an epic performance in the Eastern Conference finals game 2 only to lose to the Heat in OT. Are the Celtics getting bad calls from the refs? Was the NBA Draft lottery fixed for the Hornets? Will Tiger Woods ever win again? Will Drew Brees sign with the Saints? Is Jerry Jones for real about the Cowboys chases in 2012? All that and more! #1 Sports Show/Podcast on the World Wide Web! Join us as we break down all sports. Special guests in the past have included Mark Cuban, Kobe Bryant, Von Miller, Dirk Nowitzki, Jason "Jet" Terry, Jason Kidd, Blake Griffin, Derek Rose, Chris Paul, Phil Jackson, Tim Duncan, and many more...

item.title: GUEST MARIO CHALMERS OF THE HEAT, NBA FINALS GAME 3 REVIEW - Jun 07,2011
item.description:
Tonight we review game 3 as the Heat go up 2-1 in the series. Do the Mavs have to win both game 4 and 5 at home to have a chance? Why has Cory Brewer not played in this series? What was Lebron rapping in the locker room after the game? We also interview Heat guard Mario Chalmers. Find out what he thinks about his team now and why he is not scared to take the big shot. item.title: Dallas Mavericks vs Utah Jazz (PreGame Report) - Dec 12,2010
item.description:
"The win streak is not significant at all...we got to be getting better", commented Coach Carlisle as the Mavs try to extend their league best win streak to 12-0. Tonight will not be as easy as Thursday against the New Jersey Nets. This will be the Mavs second game against the Jazz in 10 days; beating them on the road the first time. Carlisle expressed how hard it has been for his team to win back-to-back games against winning teams; i.e. Denver and New Orleans as teams they lost to the second time.
  The longest tenured coach in the NBA Jerry Sloan is no dummy. When Royce asked him what will the Jazz have to do to win this game he simply said, "make shots". Even Coach Carlisle said that they have to be ready for Deron Williams and guard him without fouling. Deron, the pride of the Colony, comes back home averaging a double-double with 22pts and 10 assists. His style of play could really hurt the Mavs if he gets the bigs in foul trouble early.
  Will the Jazz be able to do what 11 teams have failed to do the last 11 games, beat the Mavs? They definitely have the talent and the coach. Its gonna be up to the Mavs to hold serve.

Dallas Mavericks | Utah Jazz | Coach | Rick Carlisle | Jerry Sloan | Deron Williams
item.content:encoded:
"The win streak is not significant at all...we got to be getting better", commented Coach Carlisle as the Mavs try to extend their league best win streak to 12-0. Tonight will not be as easy as Thursday against the New Jersey Nets. This will be the Mavs second game against the Jazz in 10 days; beating them on the road the first time. Carlisle expressed how hard it has been for his team to win back-to-back games against winning teams; i.e. Denver and New Orleans as teams they lost to the second time.
  The longest tenured coach in the NBA Jerry Sloan is no dummy. When Royce asked him what will the Jazz have to do to win this game he simply said, "make shots". Even Coach Carlisle said that they have to be ready for Deron Williams and guard him without fouling. item.title: Cowboys Fall to 1-6; New QB, Same Result - Nov 01,2010
item.description:
Well Cowboy fans...I think its safe to start cheering for another team to go the Super Bowl. Kitna gets his first start and did get the ball out quicker to move the offense down the field, but the red zone was still a problem. Kitna throws for over 300 yards plus a touchdown to Witten, but he had 4 interceptions. Three of those you can pin solely on the wide receiving core tipping catch-able balls. The run game was nonexistent and special teams were lackluster. With the problems on offense for this season, a lot of the media has given the defense a pass. Once again another QB has his best career game against the Wade Phillips led defense. David Garrard had 5 TDs including 1 rushing touchdown leading the Jags to a 35-17 win. It wasn't even that close. Even the fearless leader of "Cowboy Nation", Jerry Jones, felt compelled after the game to apologize to fans for the 1-6 start to the season. Coach Phillips admitted in the press conference that he was "lost" at this point and does not know how to motivate the team. Next week the Cowboys go to Lambeau Field to play the Packers on Sunday Night Football. Lets just hope that Cowboy fans will take the bags off their heads in the stands for this game.

Dallas Cowboys | John Kitna | Wade Phillips | Jerry Jones | David Garrard

item.title: Cowboys Suck! Romo is out! Dez Bryant is going to Hawaii...Oh yeah...Cowboys suck! - Oct 26,2010
item.description:
Ok...Now if you guys have ever heard the show then you know I'm a Cowboy fan! But boy do they suck right now! The 1-5 Boys didn't penalize themselves to a loss this time, the just got whooped. The Giants again seemed to just be more physical then the team that needed the win. The Boys came out blazing with a TD to Witten, but failure to capitalize on another turnover should have warned me then. Miles Austin was missing sure catches, the running backs could not run, and once again our secondary looked like the should be playing Saturday morning at your local field not Monday night. Eli Manning, the only Super Bowl winning QB in the NFC East, looked like his older brother directing the pass protection and calling audibles. Did I mentioned he threw 4 TDs! Bradie James and Keith Brooking were getting pancaked by the Giants offensive line all game.

  To add insult to injury, Tony Romo breaks a collarbone in the second quarter and gives the offense to 14 year veteran John Kitna. Did I mention that he went 3 and out 14 straight times! He is done!

  Dez Bryant was the only player on the team that seemed to play with heart. He scored 3 TDs, 2 receiving and 1 on a punt return. Maybe the players need to follow a ROOKIE as a leader. He seems to be the only player trying to win after Romo went down.

  Dez...buddy pack your bags for Hawaii. Wade...pack your bags too!!!!

item.title: Dallas Cowboys lose to the Minnesota Vikings; Drops to 1 - 4 and last place in the NFC East. - Oct 17,2010
item.description:
The Boys lose again! This time to the Brett Farve and the Minnesota Vikings. Its the same story as last week, penalties and turnovers hurt the Cowboys. Mike Jenkins was still getting called for pass interference and the offensive line was still getting penalized. We have all been giving Romo a pass because of the numbers he has put up this season. At 1 - 4 all bets are off! This pro-bowl quarterback again loses another must win game by turning over the ball. Only fitting for a player that made his introduction into the mainstream fumbling away a playoff win. This is Romo's second game in a row throwing a pick to end a late game drive. As the team was getting 4 penalties in a row you did not see Wade Phillips in anyone's face holding someone accountable. The team gets another "touchdown celebration" penalty; this time in the first quarter. After all that they, end with a desperation "miracle" play that only works in Disney movies. This is not a good team. The coach is not a good coach. The quarterback is not a good quaterback. This defense is not a good defense despite what the stats say. There are no good 1 - 4 teams.

item.title: Texas Rangers win ALDS! Advance to play New York Yankees in ALCS - Oct 13,2010
item.description:
Texas Rangers win 5 -1 over the Tampa Bay Rays and thier first playoff series ever! Cliff Lee pitches a complete game to improve his post season record to 6 -  0 with an ERA of 1.44. The game was 3 - 1 until Ian Kinsler belts a two-run homer in the ninth inning to put the champagne on ice. The rangers celebrate tonight in Tampa Bay with a great win on the road. Up next is the New York Yankees, a series that will start in New York which should not be a problem for good road team like the Rangers. Cliff Lee will not be able to start until game 3 back in Arlington, but the bullpen will be ready to go.

item.title: Dallas Cowboys lose to the Tennesse Titans 34 - 27; Drop to 1 - 3 - Oct 11,2010
item.description:
If you would have told that Tony Romo would throw 31-46 for 406 yards and 3 TDs I would have said, "How much did we win by?". But no...We LOST! Romo had 3 interceptions and was sacked 6 times as the Tennesse Titans never gave up on winning the game. Vince Young and the Titans offense jumped out early and answered every score with a score of their own. Romo did have a late 4th quarter drive to tie the game at 27 with enough time left for the defense to get one last stop and let the Cowboy offense score. Mariani runs the kickoff back to the 11 yard line and gets a Buehler face mask call to put the ball on the Cowboy 6. Chris Johnson runs the ball in to put the Titans up by 7 with 3:28 to go. Plenty of time right. The Cowboys get the ball twice, but Tony Tomo throws his last interception on a give up to Roy Williams with :42 left. We have plenty to talk about on Tuesdays show....Don't miss it!

NFL Week 5 Review Show Airs Tuesday 10/12/2010 at 9:00 cst

Box Score: http://www.scores.espn.go.com/nfl/boxscore?gameId=301010006

item.title: Randy Moss is a Minnesota Viking....Again!!! - Oct 07,2010
item.description:
That's Right! Randy Moss is now officially back with the team that drafted him. The New England Patriots traded Randy Moss for draft picks that will give them full control of next years draft. They will have 2 picks in each of the 4 rounds, but who really wins here. The Pats lose a proven hall-of-famer that stretches the field like no other. This has allowed players like Wes Welker and their new addition Whitehead to get the ball underneath and be effective. Bill Belichek has confidence in the "system" in the hands of Tom Brady to keep the Pats an offensive juggernaut, but having no Randy Moss could change things. Minnesota gets a reciever! The Vikings are in a desperate need of a reciever and ended up with one of the best to every play the position. They tried to get Vincent Jackson earlier in the season, but tslks fell through with the Chargers. We all know Farve is in his final season (if he makes it) and the addition of Randy opens up the entire offense. Adrian Peterson, Shiancoe, and even Percy Harvin stand the benfit the most by having the big play threat on the field. Randy Moss does not get his contract extended, but does negotiate to become an unrestricted free agent if the Vikings don't sign him long term.

Randy Moss | Minnesota | Vikings | New England | Patriots | Trade | Brett | Farve | Tom | Brady | NFL | Football

item.title: Dallas Cowboys get first win against the Houston Texans - Sep 27,2010
item.description:
Dallas Cowboys get their first win in Houston against the Texans. The offense finally took off the handcuffs and imposed it's will on the worst ranked pass defense in the NFL. Tony Romo threw the ball with accuracy to all the wide receivers. The running game came alive with Marion Barber and Felix Jones. This Tuesday, RF Sports Radio gives a full recap and analysis of the game with a roundtable discussion. The shows airs on Blog Talk Radio Tuesday, September 28th, 2010  from 9 to 11pm CST.
www.blogtalkradio.com/rfsports

item.title: Texas Rangers clinch the AL West! - Sep 26,2010
item.description:
Its been 11 years since Dallas/Ft Worth could enjoy both Major League Baseball and NFL action in October.   Neftali Feliz ends the ninth inning with two clutch pop flys to give the Rangers the 4 - 3 win. Its only fitting that manager Ron Washington clinches in Oakland against the A's, a team he was on the coaching staff for many years. The Rangers celebrated to a chorus of "boo's" as a dream became reality. GM John Daniels deserves a big pat on the back for sticking to the course of developing young talent. The key acquisitions this year of Cliff Lee, Vlad, and Molina paid off huge dividends on an already talented team. The only thing left now is to see who wraps up the AL East.
